entry.title: The Designation of Schools having a Religious Character (England) (No. 2) Order 2008
entry.summary: This Order designates further voluntary schools as having a religious character in accordance with section 69(3) of the School Standards and Framework Act 1998 (“the Act”).

entry.title: The Gambling (Operating Licence and Single-Machine Permit Fees) (Amendment) (No 2) Regulations 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Gambling (Operating Licence and Single-Machine Permit Fees) Regulations 2006 S.I. 2006/3284 (“the 2006 Regulations”).

entry.title: The Police Service of Northern Ireland (Promotion) Regulations 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations revoke and replace the Royal Ulster Constabulary (Promotion) Regulations 1995 (S.R. 1995/120) (“the 1995 Regulations”).

entry.title: The Education and Skills Act 2008 (Commencement No. 1 and Savings) Order 2008
entry.summary: This Order is the first commencement order made under the Education and Skills Act 2008 (“the Act”). Articles 2 and 3 bring into force on 2nd December 2008 section 151(1) and (4) of the Act in so far as it inserts new sections 88B, 88C, 88D,88E,88F,88G, 88H, 88I, 88K and88L (which relate to England only) into the School Standards and Framework Act 1998 (“the SSFA 1998”). It also commences certain consequential amendments and repeals in particular to preserve the existing law in Wales in sections 89, 89A, and 90 of the SSFA 1998.

entry.title: The General Optical Council (Committee Constitution) (Amendment) Rules Order of Council 2008
entry.summary: This Order approves Rules of the General Optical Council (“GOC”) that revise the constitutional arrangements of a number of its statutory committees by way of making amendments to the General Optical Council (Committee Constitution) Rules 2005 (“the 2005 Rules”).

entry.title: The Social Security (Lone Parents and Miscellaneous Amendments) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Income Support (General) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1987 (“the Income Support Regulations”), the Jobseeker’s Allowance Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1996 (“the Jobseeker’s Allowance Regulations”), the Social Security (Work-focused Interviews for Lone Parents) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2001 (“the Lone Parents Regulations”), the Social Security (Work-focused Interviews) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2003 (“the Work-focused Interviews Regulations”) and the Employment and Support Allowance Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2008.

entry.title: The Leeds City College (Government) Regulations 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations prescribe for the Leeds City College Further Education Corporation the provisions of the instrument providing for its constitution and its articles of government.

entry.title: The Transfrontier Shipment of Radioactive Waste and Spent Fuel Regulations 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations revoke and replace the Transfrontier Shipment of Radioactive Waste Regulations 1993. They continue to implement Council Directive 96/29/Euratom laying down basic standards for the protection of the health of workers and the general public against the dangers arising from ionizing radiation, and implement Directive 2006/117/Euratom on the supervision and control of shipments of radioactive waste and spent fuel.

entry.title: The Takeover Code (Concert Parties) Regulations 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations modify the application of Rule 9 of the City Code on Takeovers and Mergers (“the Takeover Code”).

entry.title: The Channel Tunnel Rail Link (Nomination) Order 2008
entry.summary: The Secretary of State may by order made under the Channel Tunnel Rail Link Act 1996 (“the 1996 Act”) specify who is a nominated undertaker in relation to the Channel Tunnel Rail Link (now usually called the High Speed 1 railway). This Order provides that HS1 Limited is the nominated undertaker for the purposes specified in article 3. HS1 Limited was previously named Union Railways (North) Limited.

entry.title: The Provision of School Lunches (Disapplication of the Requirement to Charge) (Scotland) Order 2008

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Provision of School Lunches (Disapplication of the Requirement to Charge) (Scotland) Order 2008

entry.summary: Section 57 of the Local Government in Scotland Act 2003 (“the 2003 Act”) provides, among other things, for the Scottish Ministers by order to amend, repeal, revoke or disapply any legislation that they consider prevents local authorities from exercising their power under section 20(1) of the 2003 Act to do anything which the authority considers is likely to promote or improve the well-being of its area, people in that area or both of these. The section 20(1) power is known as the local authorities' ‘power to advance well-being’. The powers of the Scottish Ministers under section 57 may be exercised in relation to all local authorities, a class or classes of local authority, or a particular local authority or local authorities.

title.div: The Collaboration Arrangements (Maintained Schools and Further Education Bodies) (Wales) Regulations 2008 / Rheoliadau Trefniadau Cydlafurio (Ysgolion a Gynhelir a Chyrff Addysg Bellach) (Cymru) 2008

div.p: These Regulations enable governing bodies of maintained schools and further education bodies to develop joint working arrangements and, if they wish, to delegate the exercise of their functions to one or more joint committees.

Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn galluogi cyrff llywodraethu ysgolion a gynhelir a chyrff addysg bellach i ffurfio trefniadau cydweithio ac, os dymunant, i ddirprwyo gwaith arfer eu swyddogaethau i un neu fwy o gydbwyllgorau.

entry.title: The Travellers’ Allowances (Amendment) Order 2008
entry.summary: The table below summarises the new ‘tax and duty free’ allowances for travellers from outside the European Community, starting on 1 December 2008 (with the value added tax allowance changing again on 1 January 2009).

entry.title: The Christmas Bonus (Relevant Week) Order (Northern Ireland) 2008
entry.summary: This Order provides that for the year 2008 the relevant week for the purposes of Part X (Christmas bonus) of the Social Security Contributions and Benefits (Northern Ireland) Act 1992 is the week beginning with Monday 22nd December 2008.

entry.title: The Occupational Pensions (Revaluation) Order 2008
entry.summary: This Order is made, as required by paragraph 2(1) of Schedule 3 to the Pension Schemes Act 1993 (c.48), in the year beginning 1st January 2008 and specifies the revaluation percentages for the purpose of the revaluation on or after 1st January 2009 of benefits under occupational pension schemes, as required by section 84 of, and Schedule 3 to, that Act.

entry.title: Eel Fishing (Licence Duties) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the licence duties payable to the Fisheries Conservancy Board for Northern Ireland in respect of licences for the use of fishing engines for the taking of eels. The new duties and the size of the increases, are set out below.

entry.title: The Building (Fees) (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Building (Fees) (Scotland) Regulations 2004 (“the 2004 Regulations”).

entry.title: The Financial Assistance Scheme (Amendment) Regulations 2008
entry.summary: These Regulations amend regulation 9 of the Financial Assistance Scheme Regulations 2005 (S.I. 2005/1986, as amended) (“the FAS Regulations”) which provide for payments to be made to, or in respect of, certain members or former members of certain occupational pension schemes where the liabilities of the scheme to those people are unlikely or unable to be satisfied in full.

entry.title: The Non-Domestic Rating Contributions (England) (Amendment) Regulations 2008
entry.summary: Under Part II of Schedule 8 to the Local Government Finance Act 1988 (“the 1988 Act”), billing authorities are required to pay amounts (called non-domestic rating contributions) to an account held by the Secretary of State (“the national non-domestic rating pool”). The national non-domestic rating pool is subsequently distributed to authorities under the rules in Part III of Schedule 8 to the 1988 Act. Payments into the national non-domestic rating pool in respect of the provisional amount of the non-domestic rating contributions are made during the financial year. Final calculations and adjustments of those contributions are made after the year ends.

entry.title: The Mental Health Tribunal for Scotland (Practice and Procedure) (No. 2) Amendment Rules 2008
entry.summary: These Rules further amend the Mental Health Tribunal for Scotland (Practice and Procedure) (No. 2) Rules 2005 (“the principal Rules”), which make provision as to the practice and procedure of the Mental Health Tribunal for Scotland.
